translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with King Kinkaṇikapuppha
The Elder Naḷakuṭidāyaka’s Birth Story
“Not far from the Himalayas,
there is a mountain named Hārita;
A self-made man named Nārada
lived at the foot of a tree.
Having made a hut of reeds,
I covered it with grass;
Having swept the walking path,
I offered it to the self-made one.
By that well-done deed,
and by my intention and aspiration,
Having abandoned the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
There, the good deed I did
by making a hut of reeds,

analyzed: saṭṭhi yojanam ubbedha  tisa yojana vitthata
translated: 800 leagues high,🔽and 400 leagues wide,
For 44 eons,
I delighted in the deva world;
And 71 times,🔽I reigned as king of the devas.
44 times,
I was a wheel-turning monarch;
And countless times,
I reigned as a powerful local king.
Having ascended the Dhammapāsāda,
which is endowed with all excellent forms,
Wherever I wish to dwell,
in the dispensation of the Son of the Sakyans.
31 eons ago,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the result of the Reed Hut.
My defilements were burned up,
I dwell without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was to me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā naḷakuṭidāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā naḷakuṭidāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Reed Hut Giver recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Naḷakuṭidāyaka is finished.
